article_title: Alief ISD fair preps families for return to school
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

article_metadata.description: At the Alief event, volunteers said families came to learn about health insurance, get their kids vaccinated, receive free health screenings and pick up free school supplies.  "There is all sorts of information here to have parents and their kids be better prepared when school starts," said Laura Klubert, a prevention and safe school specialist with the Alief district.  Wykisha McKinney, a program manager with the Children's Defense Fund of Texas, said there is confusion about how to get children covered, and many kids do not get insurance even though they are qualified.  Claudia Lozano, a volunteer with Enroll America, said her organization was at the event on Saturday to try to increase enrollment in health insurance for children - a demographic she said was underinsured.  Dee Dee Grays, a spokeswoman and volunteer, said the event included everything from haircuts to health insurance information to vaccinations and health screenings.
article_metadata.author.name: By Bobby Blanchard
